pt: {sc}scold{/sc} {sc}upbraid{/sc} {sc}berate{/sc} {sc}rail{/sc} {sc}revile{/sc} {sc}vituperate{/sc} mean to reproach angrily and abusively. {sc}scold{/sc} implies rebuking in irritation or ill temper justly or unjustly.
{sc}upbraid{/sc} implies censuring on definite and usually justifiable grounds.
{sc}berate{/sc} suggests prolonged and often abusive scolding.
{sc}revile{/sc} implies a scurrilous, abusive attack prompted by anger or hatred.

pt.t: an alleged killer {it}reviled{/it} in the press

et: Middle English {it}upbreyden{/it}, from Old English {it}ūpbregdan{/it}, probably from {it}ūp{/it} up + {it}bregdan{/it} to snatch, move suddenly {ma}{mat|braid|}{/ma}
shortdef: to criticize severely : find fault with
